name: antsMotionCorr
description:
Advanced Normalization Tools (ANTs) is a C++ library available through the command line that computes high-dimensional mappings to capture the statistics of brain structure and function. It allows one to organize, visualize and statistically explore large biomedical image sets. Additionally, it integrates imaging modalities in space + time and works across species or organ systems with minimal customization.

The ANTs library is considered a state-of-the-art medical image registration and segmentation toolkit which depends on the Insight ToolKit, a widely used medical image processing library to which ANTs developers contribute. ANTs-related tools have also won several international, unbiased competitions such as MICCAI, BRATS, and STACOM.
author: ANTs developers

inputs.name: Dimensionality
inputs.description: This option forces the image to be treated as a specified-dimensional image. If not specified, the program tries to infer the dimensionality from the input image.

inputs.name: Number of images
inputs.description: This option sets the number of images to use to construct the template image.

inputs.name: Metric
inputs.description: Metrics for registration: GC (global correlation), CC (ANTS neighborhood cross correlation), MI (Mutual information), and Demons.

inputs.name: Use fixed reference image
inputs.description: Use a fixed reference image to correct all volumes, instead of correcting each image to the prior volume in the time series.

inputs.name: Use scales estimator
inputs.description: Use the scale estimator to control optimization.

inputs.name: Transform
inputs.description: Several transform options are available: Affine, Rigid, GaussianDisplacementField, SyN.

inputs.name: Iterations
inputs.description: Specify the number of iterations at each level.

inputs.name: Smoothing sigmas
inputs.description: Specify the sigma for smoothing at each level. Smoothing may be specified in mm units or voxels with 'AxBxCmm' or 'AxBxCvox'. No units implies voxels.

inputs.name: Shrink factors
inputs.description: Specify the shrink factor for the virtual domain (typically the fixed image) at each level.

inputs.name: Output transform prefix
inputs.description: Specify the output transform prefix (output format is .nii.gz ). Optionally, one can choose to warp the moving image to the fixed space and, if the inverse transform exists, one can also output the warped fixed image.

inputs.name: Average image
inputs.description: Average the input time series image.

inputs.name: Write displacement
inputs.description: Write the low-dimensional 3D transforms to a 4D displacement field.

inputs.name: Use histogram matching
inputs.description: Histogram match the moving images to the reference image.

inputs.name: Random seed
inputs.description: Use a fixed seed for random number generation.

inputs.name: Interpolation
inputs.description: Several interpolation options are available in ITK. The above are available (default Linear).

output-files.name: Output transform prefix
output-files.description: The output is the transformation matrix.

output-files.name: Warped Image
output-files.description: The output is the warped moving image.

output-files.name: Average Image Output
output-files.description: The output is the averaged image of the input time series.
